chapterTitle: Financial Leverage and Capital Structure Policy

columns.text: In this problem, we will determine the market value of the company if they decide to issue debt to finance the investment.

Before we get to solve the market value of the firm, we must first list down the given value that will be relevant in the solution:


|Value of unlevered firm |$324,029,901.96 | 
|--|--| 
|Tax rate | 23%| 
| Debt|$85,000,000 | 


Take note that the value of the unlevered firm was taken from the previous question.

Substituting the values, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{V}_L&=\$324,029,901.96+(\$85,000,000 \times 0.23)\\[15 pt]
&=\$343,579,902
\end{aligned}$$

The total market value of the firm if they issue debt is $\$343,579,902$

Substituting the values from the previous part of the problem, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Equity}&=\$343,579,902-\$85,000,000\\[15 pt]
&=\$258,579,902
\end{aligned}$$

The total equity of the company is $\$258,579,902$

Right now, the balance sheet looks like this:


|Total debt | $85,000,000| 
|--|--| 
| Total equity| $258,579,902| 
| Total market value of the firm| $343,579,902| 
| Shares outstanding|8,000,000 |

The final balance sheet, with the price per share, will then be:


| Total Debt| $85,000,000| 
|--|--| 
| Total Equity|$258,579,902 | 
|Total Market Value |$343,579,902 | 
| Shares outstanding|8,000,000 | 
| Price per share|$32.3225 |
